tit.e: Bansha no goku (Imprisonment of scholars of Western learning)
Bansha no goku (Imprisonment of scholars of Western learning)
Bansha no goku (Imprisonment of scholars of Western learning)

sen.j: 蛮社の獄（ばんしゃのごく）とは、1839年（天保10）5月に起きた言論弾圧事件。
sen.e: Bansha no goku was the suppression of free speech in May,1839.
Bansha no goku was the suppression of free speech that occurred in May 1839.
sen.cmt: ・inの対象となる動詞がないと不自然なためoccurredを加えました。・Mayは数字ではないので、コンマは不要です。
sen.e: Bansha no goku was the suppression of free speech that occurred in May 1839.
Shoshikai (salon, a think tank)
Shoshikai (salon, a think tank)
Shoshikai (salon, a think tank)

sen.j: 蛮社とは、田原藩士渡辺崋山、高野長英、小関三英ら洋学者を中心に町医者・藩士・幕臣等有志の者が海防目的で蘭学や内外の情勢を研究していた尚歯会（しょうしかい）を、「蘭学という野蛮な結社」と国学者の側が蔑んだことによる。
sen.e: Feudal retainers of Tahara domain, Kazan WATANABE, Choei TAKANO and Dutch scholar Sanei KOSEKI organized Shoshikai (association) with interested people like town doctors, feudal retainers of domain and vassals of shogun in order to study Western learning and internal and external situation for the purpose of coastal defense, and scholars of Japanese literature named the organization as Bansha with disdain meaning was "Kessha (association) studying Yaban (barbarous) Western science".

Feudal retainers of Tahara domain, Kazan WATANABE, Choei TAKANO and Dutch scholar Sanei KOSEKI organized Shoshikai (association) with interested people like town doctors, feudal retainers of domain and vassals of shogun in order to study Western learning and internal and external situation for the purpose of coastal defense, and scholars of Japanese literature named the organization as Bansha, which has the disdainful meaning "Kessha (association) studying Yaban (barbarous) Western science."
sen.cmt: ・「with disdain meaning was」の部分は文法的に不完全なので修正しました。・指示に従って、ピリオドはクォーテーションマークの中に入れました。
sen.e: Feudal retainers of Tahara domain, Kazan WATANABE, Choei TAKANO and Dutch scholar Sanei KOSEKI organized Shoshikai (association) with interested people like town doctors, feudal retainers of domain and vassals of shogun in order to study Western learning and internal and external situation for the purpose of coastal defense, and scholars of Japanese literature named the organization as Bansha, which has the disdainful meaning "Kessha (association) studying Yaban (barbarous) Western science."

sen.j: ただし、尚歯会自体への弾圧ではなく、尚歯会の関係者の一部が処罰された事件である（尚歯会主宰の遠藤勝助は処罰されていない）。
sen.e: However, this wasn't the suppression of Shoshikai, this was the oppression of the relevant people in Shoshikai (the leader of Shoshikai, Katsusuke ENDO wasn't punished).
However, this was not the suppression of Shoshikai, but was the oppression of some relevant people in Shoshikai (the leader of Shoshikai, Katsusuke ENDO, was not punished).
sen.cmt: ・短縮形はくだけた言い方なので修正しました。・2文の間に接続詞がないため加えました。・ENDOの後にコンマが必要です。・訳漏れです。
sen.e: However, this was not the suppression of Shoshikai, but was the oppression of some relevant people in Shoshikai (the leader of Shoshikai, Katsusuke ENDO, was not punished).

sen.j: モリソン号事件を知った高野長英は「戊戌夢物語」で幕府の異国船打払令に反対した。
sen.e: Since Choei TAKANO discovered the Morrison incident that opposed the edict to repel foreign vessels issued by bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) in his book "Bojutsu yumemonogatari" (戊戌夢物語), bakufu targeted Shoshikai as they heightened the sensitivity due to Oshio Heihachiro no ran (Rebellion of Oshio Heihachiro).

Choei TAKANO, learning about the Morrison incident, opposed the edict to repel foreign vessels issued by the bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) in his book 'Bojutsu yumemonogatari.'
sen.cmt: ・一原文一訳文例外対処・訳漏れです。・戊戌夢物語→Bojutsu yumemonogatari [定訳不明です]・大きな誤訳があったため、大幅に書き直しました。
sen.e: Choei TAKANO, learning about the Morrison incident, opposed the edict to repel foreign vessels issued by the bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) in his book 'Bojutsu yumemonogatari.'

sen.j: これを、大塩平八郎の乱で神経を尖らせていた幕府目付鳥居耀蔵が敵視し尚歯会に目をつけていた。
sen.e: Yozo TORII, the bakufu's metsuke (inspector of foot soldiers), hostilely viewed his opposition and targeted Shoshikai as he had heightened the sensitivity due to Oshio Heihachiro no ran (Rebellion of Oshio Heihachiro).
sen.cmt: ・一原文一訳文例外対処・訳漏れです。
sen.e: Yozo TORII, the bakufu's metsuke (inspector of foot soldiers), hostilely viewed his opposition and targeted Shoshikai as he had heightened the sensitivity due to Oshio Heihachiro no ran (Rebellion of Oshio Heihachiro).

sen.j: また、鳥居が、尚歯会員である幕臣江川英龍と江戸湾岸の測量手法を巡って争った際に、渡辺崋山の人脈と洋学による知識を借りた江川に敗れた。
sen.e: In addition, when Torii argued with the Shogun's retainer, EGAWA, a member of the Shoshikai, over the survey method of Edo Bay, Torii defeated by Egawa since Egawa utilized Kazan WATANABE's connections and knowledge of Western science, as a result Torii was given a reprimand by the roju (senior councilor), Tadakuni MIZUNO, and Torii regarded Egawa as a political rival.

In addition, when Torii argued with Hidetatsu EGAWA, the Shogun's retainer and a member of the Shoshikai, over the survey method of Edo Bay, Torii was defeated by Egawa, who utilized Kazan WATANABE's connections and knowledge of Western science.
sen.cmt: ・一原文一訳文例外対処・訳漏れです。・文法的なミスがいくつかあったため書き直しました。
sen.e: In addition, when Torii argued with Hidetatsu EGAWA, the Shogun's retainer and a member of the Shoshikai, over the survey method of Edo Bay, Torii was defeated by Egawa, who utilized Kazan WATANABE's connections and knowledge of Western science.

sen.j: そのために老中水野忠邦に叱責されたこともあって、鳥居は政敵としても警戒していた。
sen.e: As a result, Torii was given a reprimand by the roju (senior councilor) Tadakuni MIZUNO, and Torii regarded Egawa as a political rival.
sen.cmt: ・一原文一訳文例外対処・訳漏れです。・文法的なミスがいくつかあったため書き直しました。
sen.e: As a result, Torii was given a reprimand by the roju (senior councilor) Tadakuni MIZUNO, and Torii regarded Egawa as a political rival.

sen.j: 発端は「海外渡航をたくらんでいる者がいる」という尚歯会員による内部告発があったことによる。
sen.e: At first, there was an internal leak from Shoshikai saying "someone is planning to travel abroad".
At first, there was an internal leak from Shoshikai saying 'someone is planning to travel abroad.'
sen.cmt: ・原文に合わせて、クォーテーションマークをダブルからシングルにしました。・指示に従って、ピリオドをクォーテーションマークの中に入れました。
sen.e: At first, there was an internal leak from Shoshikai saying 'someone is planning to travel abroad.'

sen.j: 内容に信憑性が薄かったにもかかわらず事件化したことから、この告発そのものが鳥居による謀略と言われている。
sen.e: Since the credibility of the leak was very low, it is said that this accusation itself was a plot developed by Torii.
In spite of the low credibility of the leak, it became an incident; hence, it is said that this accusation itself was a plot developed by Torii.
In spite of the low credibility of the leak, it became an incident; hence, it is said that this accusation itself was a plot developed by Torii.

sen.j: 渡辺崋山は逮捕、高野長英は自首した。
sen.e: Kazan WATANABE was arrested and Choei TAKANO surrendered himself to the police.
Kazan WATANABE was arrested and Choei TAKANO surrendered himself to the police.
Kazan WATANABE was arrested and Choei TAKANO surrendered himself to the police.

sen.j: 小関三英は逮捕をまたず自殺した。
sen.e: Sanei KOSEKI committed suicide before being arrested.
Sanei KOSEKI committed suicide before being arrested.
Sanei KOSEKI committed suicide before being arrested.

sen.j: 同志の町人3人は取調中病死した。
sen.e: Townspeople in Shoshikai died from disease during the investigation.
Townspeople in Shoshikai died from disease during the investigation.
Townspeople in Shoshikai died from disease during the investigation.

sen.j: 「慎機論」などによる幕政批判の罪で渡辺崋山は伝馬町入牢ののち、国元蟄居（その後自殺）、高野長英は入牢となった。
sen.e: Kazan WATANABE was put in prison in Denmacho town for criticizing bakufu in "Shinkiron" (慎機論) (personal document criticizing Bakufu), and was confined to his house (later committed suicide), and Choei Takano was sent to prison.

Kazan WATANABE was put in prison in Denmacho town for criticizing the bakufu in 'Shinkiron' (personal document criticizing the bakufu) and then was confined to his house (later committed suicide), and Choei TAKANO was sent to prison.
sen.cmt: ・Takanoは指示に従って大文字表記としました。・クォーテーションマークを原文に合わせました。・bakufuには定冠詞が必要なため付けました。・慎機論→Shinkiron [定訳不明です]
sen.e: Kazan WATANABE was put in prison in Denmacho town for criticizing the bakufu in 'Shinkiron' (personal document criticizing the bakufu) and then was confined to his house (later committed suicide), and Choei TAKANO was sent to prison.

sen.j: なお、「慎機論」は出版されてはおらず、家宅捜査時に草稿が発見されたものである。
sen.e: "Shinkiron" wasn't published and only the draft was discovered during a house search.
Shinkiron' had not been published and only the draft was discovered during a house search.
sen.cmt: ・クォーテーションマークを原文に合わせました。・時制が合っていないため修正しました。
sen.e: Shinkiron' had not been published and only the draft was discovered during a house search.

sen.j: 幕府保守層や儒学者たちによる蘭学者に対する一大弾圧事件などではなく、尚歯会を敵視する鳥居が他の幕閣の容認のもと、単独で決行したのが真相である。
sen.e: This wasn't a suppression of Dutch scholars by the Bakufu conservatives or Confucian scholars, the truth was that Torii who perceived Shoshika as an enemy acted solely with other cabinet officials with the Shogunate's approval.

This was not a suppression of Dutch scholars by the Bakufu conservatives or Confucian scholars, but the truth was that Torii, who perceived Shoshikai as an enemy, acted solely with other cabinet officials with the Shogunate's approval.
sen.cmt: ・短縮形はくだけた表現なので修正しました。・2文が連なっていたため、接続詞を付け加えました。・who perceived～enemyは非制限用法なのでコンマを付しました。
sen.e: This was not a suppression of Dutch scholars by the Bakufu conservatives or Confucian scholars, but the truth was that Torii, who perceived Shoshikai as an enemy, acted solely with other cabinet officials with the Shogunate's approval.

sen.j: また逮捕者十数名とはいえ、これは長らく、蘭学弾圧事件として捉えられてきたが、これは明治期の藤田茂吉『洋学東漸史』が、当時の自由民権運動との類推で事件を捉えたからである。
sen.e: This incident was considered as a suppression of Western learning for a long time even if there were just more than a dozen arrestees, this is because "Yogakutozenshi" (洋学東漸史) written by Mokichi FUJITA in the Meiji period described this incident in the ration with Movement for Liberty and People's Right by parity of reasoning.

This incident had been considered as a suppression of Western learning for a long time even though there were just more than a dozen arrestees, because "Yogakutozenshi" written by Mokichi FUJITA in the Meiji period described this incident in relation with Movement for Liberty and People's Right by parity of reasoning.
sen.cmt: ・この場合、even ifではなくeven thoughが適切と思われます。・This incident wasの時制が正しくないため修正しました。・this isは不要です。・洋学東漸史→Yogakutozenshi [定訳不明です]・ration→relationのスペルミスと思われます。
sen.e: This incident had been considered as a suppression of Western learning for a long time even though there were just more than a dozen arrestees, because "Yogakutozenshi" written by Mokichi FUJITA in the Meiji period described this incident in relation with Movement for Liberty and People's Right by parity of reasoning.
